content: After showing us the first three ballet positions she sat down to rest. She took her shoes off. Her toes were showing blood. I noticed then the lines in her face, the traces of gray in her black hair. I felt so sorry for her I decided to go ahead and sign up for her course. But once I left that room, back out into the dust, wind-flurried afternoon, I never did return. Ballet seemed then some terrible misuse of the body.
author: Jeanne Wakatsuki Houston & James D. Houston
